channel.title: Motivation
channel.description:
[b]how can i find motivation?[/b], i seem to find myself being very lazy and have no desire to do anything.
i have lots of university work i could be doing, but i avoid it at all costs.

item.title: Motivation
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Just try to make long-term goals more important to yourself than short-term goals. I say just, but it’s actually pretty darn hard. I guess slicing long-term goals into short phases might help. Like when you want to get an 10 (A++?) on a test that’s in a months time, you might want to be able to answer all questions of one chapter correctly this week, next chapter next week etc.

Of course good grades have to be an incentive to you, or else you’ll have a really hard time. Because good grades themselves are in a way short-term goals, to the long-term goal of getting a good job.

Read full topic

item.title: Motivation
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

Once you’re motivated to do something, you usually have a reason to do it, no?

for example, you motivate kids with candy, so they want to do whatever it is they didn’t want to do before, because now they get candy

or you motivate yourself into wanting to pass a class so you do your classwork

Good luck motivating yourself without SOME sort of incentive, this is why the topic was created in the first place, he needed a reason to want to do his work

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

i dont think wanting to do it or not matters

you can be motivated to do something you dont want to do

item.title: Motivation
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

So I stopped smoking weed 8 days ago(not out of choice, due to lack of funds) and had been smoking it pretty much every day for the past month and a half. During this time I’ve been unable to sleep properly getting about 4 hours a day but my god I’ve been so damned motivated. I have had an insatiable want to complete all my coursework and usually when it’s finished I say fuck it and don’t go over it, but I’ve gone over my courseworks many times checking and changing things to make it better. I even cleaned the shit out of my room(although I had to do that anyway kuz landlords were visiting) and I did all my washing at 3am.

My friend lives pretty close about a 10 minute walk and I usually drive it out of convenience and in case it starts raining but it was raining and I just felt like I wanted to walk it so I did.

I wish I could be this motivated all the time but I have a feeling it’ll wear off very shortly. It’s very handy that this happened this week as all my coursework has been due in late this week/early next.

It’s crazy to think how much time we waste sleeping.

Read full topic

item.title: Motivation
item.dc:creator: @SETO SETO
item.description:
@SETO wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:22, topic:419488”]I just browse this forum for 15-20 mins a day. It gets so boring after that much time that I have to do something constructive. Like this morning, it is the end of year holidays (10 weeks) and I randomly got out a big Calculus text book for next year and started reading it. And I don’t even have school till February!

tl;dr READ MITB TILL BORED THEN GTFO COMPUTER[/quote]
just read MITB and u’ll be bored

Read full topic

item.title: Motivation
item.dc:creator: @_Rick1 _Rick
item.description:
@_Rick1 wrote:

bootnecklad:

One thing I have found is actually WANTING to be motivated. For ages I kept saying I was going to be more motivated but didn’t actually mean it, its a slow process. No good saying it when you want it but you don’t feel like it. Vicous cycle.

This.

I’m pretty much in the same situation. I tried countless times to “find motivation”, but it’s not going to happen just like that. Some people need to be challenged and competed with to find motivation. I know for a fact that competing with someone can really drive me to do alot more then normally. I try to see everything as a competition, that is all.

Read full topic

item.title: Motivation

item.description:

item.title: Motivation
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:14, topic:419488”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=522033.msg3795936#msg3795936 date=1319613496]
Ive found thinking of my future a positive motivator. Planning helps me too as one of the main issues with my motivation is knowing what to start first, I’ve setup a http://todoist.com/ profile and organised my projects and tasks into a todo list.

also its very true about helping others, I’m going to try help my course mates.
[/quote]

I guess planning is the best way to motivate yourself. Make a planning that includes both studying and time to relax. Including some fresh air in your schedule also helps. Especially now, when I can’t sit outside nor have my windows open because it’s getting colder outside, I study for 2 hours or so and just stroll in our garden for 15 minutes.[/quote]

good advice, thanks.

Read full topic
